title: Spelt and honey loaf
blurb: A nutty and hearty bread made with spelt flour and honey.
method: Combine the starter, flour, and water for the starter build.
Mix the flours and water in a large mixing bowl for the dough and cover with a damp cloth for the autolyse.
Mix the ripe and bubbly starter with the flour and water mixture, then mix in the honey and salt.
Cover the dough and set aside in a warm place for at least 50 minutes, before your first set of folds.
Complete six sets of folds, resting the dough in between each one for 30 minutes.
Cover the dough with a damp cloth and leave to prove at room temperature for 2-3 hours.
Pre-shape the dough, cover with a damp cloth and leave it to rest on the bench for 15-20 minutes.
Shape the dough as desired, then place it seam side up in a lightly floured proving basket.
Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for a few hours, or in the fridge overnight, until ready to bake.

Preheat the oven to the maximum temperature and bake according to your preferred method. If using the Dutch oven, bake for 20 minutes at maximum temperature with the lid on, then take the lid off, reduce the temperature to 200°C (390°F) and bake for another 5 minutes, or until the crust is a lovely den brown. If using a hearthstone, reduce the oven to 200°C (390°F) after you put the bread in, and check the loaf after 20 minutes. You want a deep golden brown crust, without burning.
Tip the bread out of the pan onto a wire rack to cool.
other: Spelt is closely related to wheat, although it has a higher proportion of gliadin proteins. This makes it good for bread making.

Around 4-6 hours before you plan to mix your dough, combine the starter, flour, and water for the starter build, mixing well to combine (see ‘How to make and maintain a starter’, page 16). You will use 50 g (154 02) of this for the dough; retain the rest for maintaining your starter.
If you have multiplied the recipe, divide the dough into individual loaves before you pre-shape.
This bread is very good eaten about 20 minutes after baking, so it's still warm inside.
